articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands of Palestinians fled the northern Gaza Strip on Saturday ahead of an expected Israeli ground assault, while Israel said it kept two roads open to let people escape.
articles.title: Israel and Hamas at war: Latest news

articles.author: Sharon Bernstein
articles.description: Jewish and Palestinian Muslim communities in the United States remain on edge a week after the brutal attack by Hamas militants on Israeli civilians and Israel's subsequent reprisals in the Hamas-controlled Gaza Strip.
articles.title: Grieving and on edge, US Jews, Muslims seek solace as Hamas-Israel war rages

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: As an unrelenting Israeli bombardment intensified on Saturday, bakeries in Gaza were running out of bread, drinking water was in short supply and power outages left families without charged phones to find out if fleeing relatives were safe.
articles.title: As Israel bombards Gaza, bakeries run out of bread, water runs low

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: The U.S. government on Saturday advised its citizens in Gaza to move south toward the Rafah border crossing with Egypt to be ready for its possible reopening amid the humanitarian crisis in the coastal enclave after a Hamas attack in Israel drew Israeli military retaliation.
articles.title: US advises its citizens in Gaza to move closer to Egypt's Rafah crossing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's national security adviser said on Saturday hostilities with Lebanese Hezbollah in parallel with the Gaza war appeared to be restrained and warned the group not to take action that could lead to Lebanon's "destruction".
articles.title: Israel warns Hezbollah to stay out of Gaza war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The humanitarian situation in Gaza, already critical, is now "fast becoming untenable," U.N. aid chief Martin Griffiths said in a statement on Saturday.
articles.title: UN aid chief: situation is Gaza 'fast becoming untenable'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military said on Saturday its forces were preparing to implement a wide range of operational offensive plans as expectations grew of an imminent invasion of the Gaza Strip, a week after Hamas gunmen launched a devastating attack on Israel.
articles.title: Israeli military preparing for 'significant ground operations'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 1 million Palestinians in northern Gaza faced an Israeli deadline on Saturday to flee south, and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel had only just begun to retaliate for last week's Hamas rampage across southern Israel.
articles.title: Palestinians face Israeli deadline to leave northern Gaza

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: When Israel told residents of Gaza to leave their homes in the densely populated Palestinian enclave ahead of an expected ground offensive, Fawziya Shaheen, 90, recalled a dark chapter that is seared into the consciousness of Palestinians.
articles.title: Palestinians haunted by 'Nakba' while bracing for Gaza offensive

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron has ordered 7,000 soldiers to be mobilised for increased security patrols, his office said on Saturday, a day after a teacher was stabbed to death in an Islamist attack.
articles.title: France mobilises 7,000 troops for extra security patrols
